title: How to Beat the First Level of Sonic Heroes (Sea Gate)

steps.headline: Look at the floating TV shaped monitors.
steps.description: Each one shows you what type you should be using. The Blue one represents the Speed Type which is Sonic, Shadow, Amy, or Espio. The Yellow one represents the Fly Type which is Tails, Rouge, Cream & Cheese, or Charmy. The Red one represents the Power Type which is Knuckles, Omega, Big, or Vector.

steps.headline: Go past those and go through the Blue Gate.
steps.description: If you're the Fly or Power Type, it will change you the Speed Type.

steps.headline: Use the Homing attack by pushing X twice.
steps.description: The Homing attack automatically locks on to items and enemies. Use it to jump on the spring.

steps.headline: After a while, you should come to a hill.
steps.description: To get passed it, you will need to use Rocket Accel. Use the attack button and your Speed type should roll up into a ball and bounce off its team-mates. If you don't wait until all team-mates are together, you will perform a different attack.

steps.headline: You will come to a part about the level up feature.
steps.description: Each time you level up, your attacks get stronger. You can get level up by defeating enemies or finding Power cores.

steps.headline: Fly Type is up next!
steps.description: Switch to the Fly type and fly up the hill. You can fly in place by double-tapping the jump button, a green gauge will appear on the screen, that is how much fly power you have left.

steps.headline: You will then reach a part which needs you to fly over a gap.
steps.description: Don't worry if you fall though, as there are springs below.

steps.headline: There will then be enemies.
steps.description: Press the attack button to perform Thunder Shoot. This attacks temporally paralyzes enemies.

steps.headline: Power Type is next!
steps.description: Power types are good for crushing enemies with devastating combos. Smash the boxes and crates until you reach the other side of the tunnel.

steps.headline: Jump on the spring and beat the next batch of enemies.
Team Blast!
steps.description: When you get the Team Blast Core, press the button indicated on the screen to use Team Blast. Team Blast varies on the team. You can fill the gauge for Team Blast by collecting items, rings or using formation action.

text: Look at the floating TV shaped monitors. Each one shows you what type you should be using. The Blue one represents the Speed Type which is Sonic, Shadow, Amy, or Espio. The Yellow one represents the Fly Type which is Tails, Rouge, Cream & Cheese, or Charmy. The Red one represents the Power Type which is Knuckles, Omega, Big, or Vector. Go past those and go through the Blue Gate. If you're the Fly or Power Type, it will change you the Speed Type. Run down the ramp.  Use the Homing attack by pushing X twice. The Homing attack automatically locks on to items and enemies. Use it to jump on the spring. After a while, you should come to a hill. To get passed it, you will need to use Rocket Accel. Use the attack button and your Speed type should roll up into a ball and bounce off its team-mates. If you don't wait until all team-mates are together, you will perform a different attack. You will come to a part about the level up feature. Each time you level up, your attacks get stronger. You can get level up by defeating enemies or finding Power cores. Fly Type is up next! Switch to the Fly type and fly up the hill. You can fly in place by double-tapping the jump button, a green gauge will appear on the screen, that is how much fly power you have left. You will then reach a part which needs you to fly over a gap. Don't worry if you fall though, as there are springs below. There will then be enemies. Press the attack button to perform Thunder Shoot. This attacks temporally paralyzes enemies. Power Type is next! Power types are good for crushing enemies with devastating combos. Smash the boxes and crates until you reach the other side of the tunnel. Some enemies should be there. Beat them! Jump on the spring and beat the next batch of enemies. Jump on another spring. Team Blast! When you get the Team Blast Core, press the button indicated on the screen to use Team Blast. Team Blast varies on the team. You can fill the gauge for Team Blast by collecting items, rings or using formation action. Get to the Goal Ring. And you've done the stage!
